        public boolean addPlug​(char firstEnd,
                       char secondEnd)
        Pass the 2 ends to the myplugboard and get a boolean representing whether the 2 sockets were connected successfully or whether no Plug got created
        Parameters:
        firstEnd - the first socket as Char
        secondEnd - the second socket as Char
        Returns:
        boolean The status of connecting the 2 ends

      • clearPlugboard

        public void clearPlugboard​()
        Remove all the Plugs already connected

      • encodeLetter

        protected char encodeLetter​(char letterToEncode)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Take each character, swap with a different letter if there is a Plug connected and convert it into an integer.Successively change it to a different chacater by using the BasicRotor.substitute(int) or BasicRotor.substitute(int) until the chacater gets to the Reflector. There the specific Reflector.substitute(int) is used and the character is send back to the third Rotor, then to the second Rotor, then to the first Rotor. In all those cases, the inverse mapping is used using BasicRotor.substituteBack(int) or BasicRotor.substituteBack(int).Change the integer back to a char and swap it if there is a Plug connected.Rotate the first Rotor to signal the end of a full operation.
        Parameters:
        letterToEncode - The character to encode/decode
        Returns:
        char the character decoded/encoded
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Character not valid

      • getReflector

        public Reflector getReflector​()
        Return the Reflector contained in 'this'
        Returns:
        Reflector the reference in the current object

      • getRotor

        public Rotor getRotor​(int positionInSlot)
        Return the Rotor at a specified index in slot
        Parameters:
        positionInSlot - index in slot
        Returns:
        Rotor the rotor at that index in array

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(int positionInSlot,
                        int initialPosition)
        Setting the initial position of the Rotor at the index specified as parameter in the array
        Parameters:
        positionInSlot - the place of the Rotor in the array
        initialPosition - the position of the Rotor

      • start

        public java.lang.String start​(java.lang.String inputToDecode)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Split the String passed into an array of chars Decode each char using encodeLetter(char) Add the decoded char to a StringBuilder After all the letters have been decoded, change the format of the result from StringBuilder to a String
        Parameters:
        inputToDecode - The encoded message
        Returns:
        String The decoded message
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Character not valid
